174.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post remembering her late mother, veteran actress Sridevi, on her birth anniversary. Sharing a childhood picture of herself with her mother, Janhvi wrote, "Happy birthday Mumma. I miss you more and more every day." Sridevi passed away in 2018 while she was in Dubai to attend a family wedding.

175.title: 2 B'deshi nationals held in Delhi with 11 passports, fake govt stamps
175.article_body: The Delhi Police have apprehended two Bangladeshi nationals from the city's Palam area and recovered from them several passports as well as 10 fake stamps belonging to various Bangladesh ministries, according to an official. "On search, [the accused] were found to be in possession of 11 passports of different Bangladeshi citizens...About the...stamps, they had no substantive answer," police said.

176.title: 6 of top 10 most valued firms added ₹1.56 lakh cr to m-cap last week
176.article_body: The combined market capitalisation (m-cap) of six of the top 10 most valued firms surged by ₹1.56 lakh crore last week. While Reliance Industries, Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, HDFC and Bajaj Finance recorded gains in their m-cap, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever and Life Insurance Corporation suffered losses. Reliance Industries' m-cap rose the most to ₹17.81 lakh crore.

177.title: Railways to hold heritage run of 167-year-old steam engine on I-Day
177.article_body: Indian Railways will hold a heritage run of a 167-year-old locomotive, which is the world's oldest working steam engine, on Independence Day. The special service will run between Chennai's Egmore and Kodambakkam railway stations. "The beautiful sound of the whistle will send you back to the times of the steam locomotive from the days gone by," Divisional Railway Manager said.

178.title: B'luru Traffic Police shares list of roads to be avoided on I-Day
178.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police has shared a list of roads to be avoided on August 15 due to various Independence Day events. It has been advised to avoid taking Cubbon Road from 7 am to 11 am. As per the advisory, MKK Road, Tumkur Road, Vatal Nagraj Road, and Rajkumar Road will remain affected between 8 am and 12 pm.

179.title: BlueBenx dismisses staff, suspends withdrawals after $32 mn hack: Report
179.article_body: Brazilian crypto lender BlueBenx laid off a majority of its staff and barred withdrawals of all its 22,000 members after an alleged theft of $32 million in cryptocurrency, Cointelegraph reported. An anonymous investor reportedly said there's a high probability of it being a scam as the theft "seems like...something they invented". BlueBenx had guaranteed up to 66% returns on cryptocurrency.

180.title: Such a dexterous actor: Russo Brothers on Dhanush's performance in 'Jagame...'
180.article_body: Russo Brothers have praised Dhanush's performance in his 2021 action movie 'Jagame Thandhiram'. "He is such a dexterous actor. He is able to do this very intense action, while at the same time holding on to an attitude and almost a casualness in this character," Anthony Russo said. The filmmaker duo worked with Dhanush in the film 'The Gray Man'.

181.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran plays Jaishankar's clip in rally, says 'This is an independent country'
181.article_body: During a rally in Lahore, ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan played a clip of an interview of India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and said, "This is what an independent country is." In the clip, Jaishankar responded to criticism of India buying Russian oil, saying, "Our total purchases for the month would be less than what Europe does in an afternoon."

182.title: At least 40 people killed after massive fire inside a church in Egypt
182.article_body: At least 40 people have been killed and several others have been injured after a massive fire broke out inside a church in Egypt. The fire erupted when around 5,000 worshippers had gathered for the mass at the Coptic Abu Sifin church in the Imbaba neighbourhood. The fire blocked an entrance to the church, causing a stampede.

183.title: 791 new cases of COVID-19 logged in Bengaluru on Saturday
183.article_body: Bengaluru reported 791 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Saturday with a positivity rate of 6.48%, as per data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike chief Tushar Giri Nath. The cases took Bengaluru's active case count to 6,781. No new deaths due to the infection were recorded on Saturday. With the addition of the new cases, Bengaluru's COVID-19 tally reached 18,50,840.

184.title: Militant attack thwarted in Manipur ahead of 76th I-Day; 7 arrested
184.article_body: At least seven militants of the banned People's Liberation Army have been arrested from across Manipur ahead of India's 76th Independence Day, police said on Sunday. The Assam Rifles had received inputs about the outfit's plot to target government installations and security forces with explosives on August 15, police said. Ammunition including hand grenades has been seized, police added.

185.title: 'Totally unacceptable': Kerala Guv on Jaleel's 'Azad Kashmir' remark
185.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Sunday criticised remarks made by LDF leader KT Jaleel on Kashmir and said it was "totally unacceptable". Jaleel kicked off a row after he shared a Facebook post, where he called Jammu and Kashmir "Indian adheena Jammu and Kashmir" (India-Occupied Jammu and Kashmir) and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir "Azad Kashmir".

186.title: Portfolios allocated in Maha; CM keeps Urban Development, Fadnavis gets Home & Finance
186.article_body: Portfolios were allocated to Maharashtra ministers on Sunday as Chief Minister Eknath Shinde kept Urban Development, Information and Technology, and Information and Public Relations, among other portfolios. Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis got Home, and Finance and Planning, among other ministries. Shambhuraj Desai got State Excise, Uday Samant got Industries and Mangal Prabhat Lodha got Tourism.

187.title: He's in same bracket as Woods, Muhammad Ali: Raza on Kohli's comparison vs Babar
187.article_body: Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza praised Virat Kohli as he compared the India batter with Pakistan captain Babar Azam, saying he would like to put Kohli in the same bracket as Tiger Woods and Muhammad Ali. "These people kind of revolutionised their sports, they thought outside the box and they tried something new which was later followed by everybody," he added.

188.title: Rahul Gandhi is silent: BJP leader after Dalit boy's death in Rajasthan
188.article_body: After a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten by his teacher leading to his death for drinking water from the latter’s pot in Rajasthan, BJP’s Y Satya Kumar said Congress' Rahul Gandhi "who has commented on every subject of the country is silent" on this matter. "This incident...is embarrassing. Incidents of atrocities on Dalits are...increasing in the state," Kumar tweeted.

189.title: 2-time champion Halep beats US' Pegula to reach 4th National Bank Open final
189.article_body: Two-time champion Simona Halep entered the final of National Bank Open, beating US' Jessie Pegula  2-6, 6-3, 6-4 in the semi-final in Toronto on Saturday. This is Halep's fourth final at the tournament. Halep will face Brazil's Beatriz Haddad Maia, who beat 14th-seeded Karolina Pliskova of the Czech Republic 6-4, 7-6(9-7) in the other semifinal.

190.title: WhatsApp working to let users set avatars as display pics: Report
190.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature which would let users set an avatar as a display picture, WABetaInfo said. It has obtained a screenshot which showed how the feature would allow users to customise avatars and choose a background colour. WhatsApp was reportedly working on a feature to allow users to answer video calls using an animated avatar.

191.title: Man suffers burn injuries as electric bike explodes in Hyderabad
191.article_body: A man sustained burn injuries on his hands and other parts of the body after his electric bike exploded in Hyderabad's Vanasthalipuram on Saturday evening, news reports said. The incident reportedly occurred in NGO colony when 33-year-old Koteshwar Rao turned on the switch to charge his two-wheeler. Rao was rushed to a nearby hospital where he is undergoing treatment.

192.title: 20-yr-old woman jumps from building after friend rapes her in Mumbai
192.article_body: The Vashi Police arrested a 28-year-old man for allegedly raping a 20-year-old woman after offering her food laced with drugs. The woman jumped from the fourth floor of her residence following the incident and sustained multiple injuries and fractures. API Kamlakar Sontake of Vashi police station said that the accused and the victim know each other.

193.title: Man who gave death threats to UP CM Yogi arrested from Rajasthan
193.article_body: A man who allegedly gave death threats to Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath a few days back was arrested from Rajasthan's Bharatpur on Sunday. A WhatsApp message threatening to kill the CM was sent on UP Police's Dial-112 helpline. He threatened to bomb CM Adityanath within three days.

194.title: Victoria Beckham's fashion label under £54 million debt: Report
194.article_body: Victoria Beckham's namesake fashion brand has reportedly accumulated a debt of £53.9 million. The fashion brand along with Beckham's new make-up company lost £6.6 million in 2020 and was up to £15.6 million in debts in 2019. Notably, David and Victoria Beckham's joint empire reportedly doubled its profit to £11.6 million in 2020.

195.title: Don't let hate campaign destroy something beautiful: Aamir's niece on 'Laal...'
195.article_body: Actress Zayn Marie Khan, niece of Aamir Khan, has come out in support of the actor over boycott calls against his latest release 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. She shared a video on her Instagram Stories, requesting everyone to watch the movie. "If you've ever felt entertained by Aamir Khan...watch 'Laal Singh Chaddha', don't let...hate campaign destroy something truly beautiful," Zayn said.

196.title: #BoycottVikramVedha trends on Twitter after Hrithik praises Aamir's 'Laal...'
196.article_body: After Hrithik Roshan praised Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha', '#boycottVikramVedha' started trending on Twitter in India. Hrithik watched 'Laal Singh Chaddha' in a theatre in Mumbai on Saturday and later urged people to watch the film. "This movie is just magnificent. Don't miss this gem guys," Hrithik wrote on Twitter. Hrithik's 'Vikram Vedha' is slated to release on September 30.

197.title: Delhi Police seals shops near Red Fort ahead of Independence Day
197.article_body: Delhi Police on Sunday sealed shops near the Red Fort for security reasons ahead of Independence Day. Around 400 CCTV cameras will be covered in and around the Red Fort area to monitor the security, a police officer said. According to police, over 10,000 police personnel will be deployed around the monument as around 7,000 invitees will arrive there.

198.title: Climate activists fill golf holes with cement in protest in France
198.article_body: Climate activists filled cement in golf course holes near France's Toulouse in a protest over the water ban exemption given to golf courses as the country faces severe drought. In a petition to get the exemption removed, the activists said that this showed that "economic madness takes precedence over ecological reason". Some restrictions on golf courses remain, reported BBC.

199.title: President's Rule should be imposed in Rajasthan: Mayawati
199.article_body: After a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten to death in an alleged casteist attack in Rajasthan's Jalore district, former UP CM Mayawati demanded the imposition of President's Rule in the state. "This incident is a clear example...that the Congress government has failed in protecting the life...of people, especially the Dalits, tribals and the neglected," Mayawati said.

200.title: US man asks about buying rifles at shop then attacks 3 with machete
200.article_body: A man was arrested after he attacked three people with a machete at a shop in Patchogue in US' New York, police said on Saturday. The incident occurred after the accused allegedly asked an employee at the shop about buying rifles but on being asked to provide identification, he showed the identification before pulling it back and walking away.

201.title: Jhunjhunwala was on chronic dialysis, had recently undergone angioplasty: Doctor
201.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala was on chronic dialysis due to a chronic kidney disease and had recently undergone an angioplasty, Doctor Pratit Samdani of Breach Candy Hospital said. Jhunjhunwala, who was also diabetic, was responding well, the doctor added. He passed away due to a sudden cardiac arrest and was brought dead to the Mumbai hospital on Sunday morning.

202.title: PM misusing partition trauma as fodder for political battles: Congress
202.article_body: Congress has alleged that PM Narendra Modi's real intent behind marking August 14 as 'Partition Horrors Remembrance Day' is to misuse "most traumatic historical events as fodder for his current political battles". "The tragedy of partition cannot be misused to fuel hate and prejudice," Congress' Jairam Ramesh tweeted. BJP earlier said it'll organise silent marches across India on Sunday.

203.title: Should’ve sided with BJP when people voted for Sena-BJP alliance: Maha CM
203.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that he should have sided with the BJP two and a half years ago when people voted for their alliance. "People voted for Shiv Sena-BJP alliance and now if I am with BJP. Where did I go wrong?" Shinde asked. Furthermore, he said, "I am still a local leader who works for the people’s benefit."

204.title: 108-foot tall national flag installed in North Kashmir
204.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, a 108-foot tall national flag has been installed at Hyderbeigh in J&K's Baramulla. The move aims to encourage people to hoist the tricolour. "This is the first of its kind installed in North Kashmir. I thank the citizens of this region to take forward the ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign,” Major General SS Slaria said.

205.title: UN-chartered ship to carry 23,000 tons of wheat to Africa: UN
205.article_body: The UN-chartered ship MV Brave Commander will depart Ukraine for Africa after it finishes loading more than 23,000 tons of wheat, a UN official said. The first Africa-bound humanitarian food aid cargo will head to Ethiopia via a grain corridor under the Black Sea Grain Initiative. UN World Food Programme and US Agency for International Development have funded the cargo.

206.title: Moosewala's close friends involved in murder, will reveal their names soon: Father
206.article_body: Balkaur Singh, the father of slain Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, has alleged that close friends of Moosewala were involved in his murder, adding that he would soon reveal their names. According to reports, Balkaur Singh has also been receiving death threats on WhatsApp from numbers based in Pakistan. Singh's security was beefed up after he received threats, reports added.

207.title: Everyone has right to voice opinions: Pankaj Tripathi on boycott trend
207.article_body: Reacting to the ongoing boycott trend against 'Raksha Bandhan' and 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Pankaj Tripathi said that people have the right to share their opinions. The actor added that while films are "a big medium that generate revenue to the government" and contribute to the betterment of the society, it is people's wish to watch them or not.

208.title: IIT Kanpur team develops app to help kids with learning disabilities
208.article_body: A team at IIT Kanpur has developed an application called Assistive Application for Children with Dyslexia and Dysgraphia (AACDD). The application provides a training module for school-going children between classes 1 and 5 in the Hindi language. The touchscreen-based interface uses haptic sensation and motor movement to produce Hindi letters and involves auditory feedback.

209.title: India have better pacers than Shami in T20 cricket: Ponting
209.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said India have better pacers than Mohammad Shami in T20 cricket. "[Shami] has been a very good bowler for India for a long time now. If you look at his strengths, his Test cricket is probably where he thrives the most," added Ponting. Shami hasn't been named in India's squad for the upcoming Asia Cup.

210.title: All languages in country are national languages: RSS chief
210.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said, "All languages in the country are national languages, all people from various castes are mine, we need to have such affection." People have small differences in language, dress and culture but they need to have a mind that will see the big picture and not get stuck into these things, he added.

211.title: Tiranga rally with 100-meter-long flag organised in Dehradun
211.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, Dehradun police organised a Tiranga rally yatra with a 100-meter-long national flag as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "We organised this rally to make the people aware about the campaign which was launched by the Centre. This rally aims to ask people to work to intact the country's freedom," Dehradun SSP said.

212.title: We will win the ODI series 2-1 against India: Zimbabwe batter Innocent Kaia
212.article_body: Zimbabwe batter Innocent Kaia has predicted that they'll win the three-match ODI series against India 2-1. "We [will] win the series. As for personal expectations, I want to be the leading run scorer and score hundreds," stated Kaia. Zimbabwe recently registered wins against Bangladesh in both T20I and ODI series. The ODI series against India will begin on August 18.

213.title: Hyderabad Traffic Police transports live heart in 35 mins via green channel
213.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police facilitated transport of a live heart via 'green channel' from Somajiguda to Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in 35 minutes. The process began at 1 pm from Yashoda Hospital in Somajiguda and was transported to Shamshabad at 1:35 pm. This year alone, Hyderabad Police facilitated organ transport 25 times through green channels.

214.title: Gujarat riots, Mughal courts to be taught in Kerala schools: Report
214.article_body: Kerala schools are likely to introduce portions of the Gujarat riots and Mughal era in their curriculum, as per a report. These sections were dropped from class 12 textbooks by the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT). After NCERT removed some sections, Kerala SCERT conducted an exercise to see if those sections can be taught in the state.

215.title: Security beefed up in J&K ahead of Independence Day
215.article_body: Security has been beefed up across J&K to ensure safety of citizens during the Independence Day celebrations. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha will take part in the function at Sher-e-Kashmir Stadium in Srinagar on Monday. "Drones are being used. Patrolling is on. Covert and overt surveillance is also on. We are confident that the celebrations would go smoothly," said Baramulla SSP.

216.title: Everyone is upset: Barca manager Xavi on 0-0 draw in La Liga opener
216.article_body: Barcelona manager Xavi Hernandez said "everyone is upset" after their 0-0 draw against Rayo Vallecano in their La Liga opener. "We tried as much as we could but we lacked aim and effectiveness. Maybe the pressure and expectation got a little under our skin," added Xavi. Notably, Robert Lewandowski and Raphinha both made their La Liga debuts in the match.

217.title: Pune Police conduct combing operation ahead of Independence Day
217.article_body: Pune Police conducted a combing operation ahead of the 76th Independence Day and ran a check on 3,381 history-sheeters. The operation started on Friday at 10pm and went on for three hours at all police stations in Pune. Police arrested 61 people for various crimes and recovered two pistols, cartridges and 35 sharp weapons from some of the accused.

218.title: DRDO counter-drone system deployed near Red Fort ahead of I-Day
218.article_body: A counter-drone system developed by DRDO has been deployed near the Red Fort in Delhi ahead of the 75th Independence Day celebration. The counter-drone system can detect and deactivate drones of any size within a radius of around 4 km, DRDO officials said. Around 1,000 high-specification cameras will also be reportedly installed in the national capital to contain aerial objects.

219.title: Lifeguard saves Mumbai man, his son from drowning in Andamans
219.article_body: An alert lifeguard saved a Mumbai man and his son from drowning at the popular Radhanagar Beach in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, officials said on Sunday. The father-son duo from Mumbai was on a trip to the islands, they said, adding that the two got caught in a current and started to drown, following which the lifeguard saved them.

220.title: Bitcoin trades above $25,000 for the first time in two months
220.article_body: Bitcoin on Sunday surpassed the $25,000 level for the first time in two months. The world's largest cryptocurrency gained 1.6% to trade at $24,882 around 4 am New York time after rising over 2% to trade above the $25,000 mark. Bitcoin is still down 46.5% year-to-date. Meanwhile, Ethereum was up about 1% at $2,011.47 on Sunday.

221.title: Vijay Sethupathi's publicist denies actor's involvement in 'Pushpa 2'
221.article_body: Actor Vijay Sethupathi's publicist has refuted the reports that said that the actor will play a negative role in 'Pushpa 2'. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Vijay isn't playing a negative role in any other Telugu projects as is being speculated." He confirmed Vijay will play a negative role in Atlee and Shah Rukh Khan's 'Jawan'.

222.title: BJP was 'untouchable' party before 1995, Nitish came to its rescue: Kushwaha
222.article_body: JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha reacted to BJP leader's "Nitish Kumar should be grateful to BJP" remark and said that BJP was considered an "untouchable" party before 1995-96 as no political party wanted to associate themselves with them. Leaders of the Samata Party George Fernandes and Nitish Kumar came to the BJP's rescue "like angels", Kushwaha added.

223.title: Policeman arrested for taking bribe of ₹5,000 in Pune
223.article_body: A police constable in Pune was arrested by the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) for taking a bribe of ₹5,000. Vijay Eknath Shinde was taking a bribe from a person against whom the police had initiated preventive legal proceedings. A complainant informed ACB's Pune unit that Shinde demanded a bribe in connection with the preventive legal proceedings initiated against him.

224.title: Woman stabs live-in partner in B'luru over 'petty quarrel'; arrested
224.article_body: A 22-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly stabbing her live-in partner to death over a petty quarrel, police said on Sunday. The incident took place in Bengaluru's Krishna Layout on Saturday when the victim questioned the accused over her mobile phone chats. After being stabbed in the neck and chest, the victim managed to run out of the house.

225.title: 10 Russian planes stuck in Germany due to EU sanctions: Report
225.article_body: At least 10 Russian planes are stuck in Germany amid EU sanctions imposed over Russia's invasion of Ukraine, news agency RedaktionsNetzwerk Deutschland reported citing Germany's ministry of transport. "Since the planes are subject to a take-off and flight ban due to...EU sanctions regime, they cannot be used by the owner and cannot be taken to another location," the ministry said.

226.title: Scotland to be 1st country to ensure access to free sanitary products
226.article_body: Scotland will become the first country in the world to protect the right to access free sanitary products with a new law that will be adopted on Monday. Under new legislation, local officials and education providers will be legally required to provide products for free to anyone in need. Additionally, government has allocated funding for menstrual health resources at institutions.

227.title: This is totally unacceptable: Kerala Guv on Jaleel's 'Azad Kashmir' remark
227.article_body: Following CPI(M)-backed independent Kerala MLA KT Jaleel's 'Azad Kashmir' remark, Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said this is totally "unacceptable". "I feel sorry for these kinds of comments…when we're celebrating 75th year of Independence…I feel hurt by these kinds of comments," Khan added. Earlier, Union Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan criticised Jaleel over his remark.

228.title: Thief uses phone, butcher's knife to steal ₹25,000 from shop in Hyd
228.article_body: A burglar used his mobile phone and a butcher's knife to steal ₹25,000 from a meat shop in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills on Friday night. The accused entered the shop after breaking the side door's lock and used his phone's torch and a butcher's knife to steal the aforementioned amount from three drawers in the shop.

229.title: Woman arrested for slapping e-rickshaw driver 17 times in Noida
229.article_body: A woman was arrested by the police on Saturday for allegedly slapping an e-rickshaw driver 17 times in Noida. The incident occurred on Friday when the accused assaulted the victim after the latter's e-rickshaw dented her car. The accused hails from Delhi and was arrested from her residence in Noida's Sector 110, a Noida Phase 2 Police Station official said.

230.title: Mali PM Maiga placed on 'forced rest' by doctor, his office says
230.article_body: Mali PM Choguel Kokalla Maiga has been placed on "forced rest" by his doctor after he worked for 14 months without a break, Maiga's office said in a statement on Saturday. Maiga would resume his activities after a week, the statement added. An adviser also denied media reports claiming that Maiga had suffered a stroke and is hospitalised, Reuters reported.

231.title: Was sporting, challenging for me to work with Vijay in 'Liger': Vish
231.article_body: Debutant Vish, who will play the lead antagonist in the film 'Liger', has said that it was "amazing" to work with actor Vijay Deverakonda. "It was very sporting and challenging for me to share screen space with him," he added. Vish further stated that he and Vijay come from the same city and have a lot of things in common.

232.title: Amitabh Bachchan sends audio message to ailing Raju Srivastava
232.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan sent an audio message to ailing comedian Raju Srivastava, wishing him a speedy recovery. In the audio message, Bachchan said, "It's enough Raju. Rise up Raju, and keep teaching us all to laugh." Raju was admitted to AIIMS in Delhi on Wednesday after suffering a heart attack.

233.title: Man electrocuted while trying to hoist Tricolour over shop in MP
233.article_body: A 45-year-old man died of electrocution while attempting to hoist a Tricolour over a shop in MP's Khargone, police said on Sunday. The deceased was trying to hoist the Tricolour over an iron rod, which came in contact with the power supply over the roof of a building, Barwaha police station in-charge Prakash Vaskale said.

234.title: PCMC to appoint transgender persons to collect taxes from residents
234.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has decided to appoint members of the transgender community to help in collecting taxes from residents. They will be appointed over a period of three months and may be given extensions on the basis of their performance, PCMC Assistant Municipal Commissioner Nilesh Deshmukh said. Earlier, PCMC also appointed transgender persons as security guards.

235.title: Attack on Salman Rushdie should be a wake-up call on Iran: Rishi Sunak
235.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak has said, "The brutal stabbing of Salman Rushdie should be a wake-up call for the West, and Iran's reaction to the attack strengthens the case for proscribing the IRGC (Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps)." There has been no official government reaction in Iran to the attack on Rushdie, but several hardline Iranian newspapers praised his assailant.

236.title: Babar Azam conferred with Pakistan's 3rd highest civilian award
236.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has been conferred with Sitara-e-Pakistan, their third-highest civilian award, on the 75th Independence Day of Pakistan. Pakistan Women's captain Bismah Maroof has been conferred with their fourth-highest civilian honour, Tamgha-e-Pakistan. Babar is currently the top-ranked batter in ODI and T20I cricket and is placed third in the longest format of the game.

237.title: Poster of Tipu Sultan put up by Congress torn by miscreants in B'luru
237.article_body: A poster featuring Tipu Sultan put up by Karnataka Congress ahead of Independence Day at Hudson Circle in Bengaluru was vandalised by miscreants on Saturday night. The party has put up posters with pictures of different freedom fighters. Karnataka Congress Chief DK Shivakumar, who visited the incident spot, said that someone is trying to create disturbance in the state.

238.title: CWG gold medallist Nikhat Zareen gifts boxing gloves to PM Modi, shares pics
238.article_body: Nikhat Zareen, who bagged a gold medal at CWG 2022, gifted boxing gloves signed by all the Indian pugilists who participated in CWG 2022 to PM Narendra Modi on Saturday. Sharing pictures on Twitter, the 26-year-old wrote, "Thank you for this amazing opportunity...A great day spent with my fellow athletes who have made the country proud."

239.title: Stalker harasses table tennis player Naina Jaiswal online using multiple accounts, held
239.article_body: A stalker has been arrested by police in Hyderabad for harassing 22-year-old table tennis player Naina Jaiswal online using multiple social media accounts. The arrest was made after Naina's father filed a complaint with Central Crime Station (CCS). Naina's father claimed that the stalker would make new accounts after getting blocked and would continue to harass her.

240.title: He's like a son I never had: Martha on rumour of dating Pete Davidson
240.article_body: Martha Stewart has reacted to a rumour that suggested that she and Pete Davidson are dating. "Pete is like the son I never had. He is a charming boy who is finding his way," she added. This comes after Pete reportedly broke up with Kim Kardashian. Kim and Pete had made their relationship official earlier this year.

241.title: Had I been picked by RCB for IPL 2011, I would've had a longer IPL career: Taylor
241.article_body: Ex-NZ cricketer Ross Taylor has said that he probably would've had a longer IPL career had he been retained by RCB for a fourth consecutive season in 2011. Taylor started his IPL career with RCB in 2008 but moved to RR ahead of the 2011 season. "While the IPL is pretty unsentimental, there is loyalty towards long-serving players," stated Taylor.

242.title: Arunachal Pradesh CM praises auto drivers' 'Freedom ride', says 'I'm in awe'
242.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu took to Twitter to praise two auto rickshaw drivers for offering free rides on occasion of Independence Day. "I'm in absolute awe of auto rickshaw drivers, Moina Bhai and Marto Zirdo, who have announced free ride, or shall I say Freedom Ride, from Ganga Market to Mithun Gate, Itanagar to celebrate #AzadiKaAmritMahotsav," Khandu tweeted.

243.title: Bihar's political experiment to meet same fate as 'chacha-bhatija' in UP: BJP
243.article_body: The countdown for Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's "political exile" has begun, with the JD(U) and RJD joining hands in the state, BJP leader Dinesh Sharma has said. He further said that Bihar will witness a repetition of the unsuccessful "chacha-bhatija" and "bua-bhatija" partnerships in UP. Nitish Kumar took oath as Bihar CM for the eighth time on August 10.

244.title: College student stabbed to death in B'luru after clash with senior
244.article_body: An 18-year-old college student was stabbed to death on Friday near Bengaluru's HBR layout area after a clash between him and his senior. Preliminary investigation has revealed that the victim and the accused had challenged each other during a college fest a few days ago. The victim's friend was also attacked when he tried to save the victim.

245.title: Indo-American pair of Sania-Madison loses in National Bank Open semis
245.article_body: Sania Mirza and her partner Madison Keys crashed out of National Bank Open after losing in women's doubles semi-final in Toronto on Saturday. The Indo-American pair lost to the all-American duo of Coco Gauff and Jessie Pegula 5-7, 5-7 in one hour 17 minutes. Third-seeded Gauff and Pegula will face unseeded pair of Ellen Perez and Nicole Melichar-Martinez in final.

246.title: B'luru acid attack victim's family seeks govt help for plastic surgeries
246.article_body: The family of a 23-year-old acid attack victim in Bengaluru has urged the Karnataka government to extend its support and help her with the plastic surgeries. The woman, who was discharged from a hospital on Friday, had suffered 36% burn injuries and had undergone 27 surgeries. Her hospital bill came up to ₹40 lakh and it was claimed through ESI.

247.title: B'luru gets new electric buses with vehicle tracking units, panic buttons
247.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai flagged off 75 new electric buses of the Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) today in front of Vidhana Soudha. The new buses, with seating capacity of 40 people, have vehicle tracking units, CCTV cameras, LED lights and emergency panic buttons for the safety of commuters. Notably, BMTC will complete 25 years of formation tomorrow.

248.title: Avoid going near banks of Yamuna: Delhi CM amid water level rise
248.article_body: Amid a rise in the water level of the Yamuna river in North Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday appealed to residents to avoid going near the banks of the river. "We've made adequate arrangements for...people living near Yamuna [river]. Cooperate with the government and administration," Kejriwal tweeted. The water level in the Yamuna river is currently 204.91 meters.

249.title: Punjab Police bust Pak-backed terror module; 3 hand-grenades, 40 live cartridges found
249.article_body: Punjab Police has busted a Pakistan-ISI-backed terror module with help of Delhi Police ahead of Independence day. Four module members associated with Canada-based Arsh Dalla and Australia-based Gurjant Singh have been arrested. Three hand-grenades, one IED, two nine mm pistols and 40 live cartridges have been recovered, DGP Punjab Police said.

250.title: Jhunjhunwala will remain inspiration for generations of young investors: Assam CM
250.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday condoled the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. "Deeply saddened by the sudden demise of prominent investor and industrialist...He has left a legacy in the arena of stockbroking and will remain an inspiration for generations of young investors and entrepreneurs," Assam CM added. "My condolences to the bereaved family," he stated.

251.title: Car with 4 family members catches fire in Pune, no one injured
251.article_body: A car carrying four family members, including two children, caught fire and was gutted entirely in Pune's New Katraj Tunnel on Sunday morning. No one was injured as the incident occurred within a few moments after the family came out of their car as they saw smoke from its engine. The family was travelling towards Satara.

252.title: Future of Afghan women, girls bleak if nothing is done: UN experts
252.article_body: UN experts in a statement have warned that the future of women and girls in Afghanistan is "bleak" if nothing is done to change the "deteriorating" human rights situation there. "The international community must...step up efforts to urge de facto authorities to adhere to basic human rights principles," the statement said. Press freedom has also been suppressed, the statement added.

253.title: Was replaced with actress who was popular in her heydays: Neena Gupta
253.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta has said that even today, some filmmakers prefer to cast a popular yesteryear actress instead of her. She remembered that once she was offered a film but soon she was replaced by "another actress who was a bigger name in her heydays". Neena had previously admitted that she was jealous of Shabana Azmi in her young days.

254.title: Truck collides with passenger bus in Pakistan; 13 dead, 5 injured
254.article_body: At least 13 people were killed and five others were injured after a sugarcane-laden truck collided with a passenger bus in Rahim Yar Khan in Pakistan's Punjab on Saturday, officials said. The officials added that rainwater had accumulated on the road and the "bus got buried under the sugarcane sacks". The truck driver reportedly escaped from the scene.

255.title: Don’t stress over what you cannot control: Pant after Urvashi's 'chotu bhaiya' comment
255.article_body: Cricketer Rishabh Pant took to Instagram Stories to share a quote amid controversy with Urvashi Rautela. "Don’t stress over what you cannot control," the quote read. Earlier, Urvashi had called Pant a "cougar hunter" and had remarked "Chotu bhaiyaa should play bat ball" after the cricketer said, "Leave me alone, sister". Pant's remark came in response to Urvashi's viral interview.

256.title: India observes Partition Horrors Remembrance Day, PM pays homage to victims
256.article_body: As India observed Partition Horrors Remembrance Day on Sunday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to pay homage to victims. "Today, on Partition Horrors Remembrance Day...I pay homage to all those who lost their lives during Partition...and applaud resilience as well as grit of all those who suffered during that tragic period of our history," the Prime Minister tweeted.

257.title: Robbers lock Fedbank staff in toilet in Chennai; loot gold and money worth ₹20 crore
257.article_body: Three armed robbers looted 32 kg gold and other valuables from branch of Fedbank Financial Services Ltd (Fedfina) in Chennai on Saturday. Preliminary investigation revealed that money and gold jewellery worth around ₹20 crore was stolen. Robbers allegedly tied employees to chairs and locked them in toilet. "Four special teams have been formed and they are currently investigating," Police said.

258.title: Toilet brush, mops hang above pizza dough in Domino's B'luru, Twitter user shares pics
258.article_body: A Twitter user shared purported photos from a Domino’s outlet in Bengaluru wherein cleaning mops were hanging above trays of pizza dough. In the two photos, a toilet brush, mops and clothes could be seen hanging on the wall and under them were placed the dough trays. Meanwhile, a Twitter user commented, "Never eating at Domino's again."

259.title: Neobanking firm Fi raises $17 mn in Series C funding round: Report
259.article_body: Bengaluru-based neobanking firm Fi has secured $15 million from Singapore's state-owned Temasek Holdings and $2 million from existing investor QCM Holdings in Series C funding round, as per regulatory filings. In June, the startup raised $45 million from Alpha Wave Global. The fundraise comes as digital lending apps grapple with RBI's lending rules which push for greater transparency.

260.title: Railways plans to add more Vistadome coaches on Mumbai-Goa route train
260.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) is planning to attach one more Vistadome coach to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT)-Madgaon Tejas Express, one of the premium trains on the Mumbai-Goa route, before this year-end, a senior railway official said. "These coaches with glass rooftops and wide window panes have proved to be a hit," CR's chief Public Relations Officer said.

261.title: Moving forward as one is something world can learn from India: RSS chief
261.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said moving forward as one is something that the world can learn from India. "We might look different. We might eat different things but there's unity in the existence," Bhagwat added. "Take a pledge to work for society and the country...Life should be dedicated to India," he said at 'Uttishtha Bharat' event in Nagpur.

262.title: Truss leads race for UK's next PM by 22 points against Sunak: Survey
262.article_body: An opinion poll conducted by Opinium Research showed UK's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss is 22 percentage points ahead of her rival and UK's former Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak in the race to become the next Prime Minister. Among a sample of 450 party members who had decided how they would vote, 61% favoured Truss while 39% favoured Sunak.

263.title: Jadeja will play in T20 WC 2022, but will not give you many wickets: Aakash
263.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja will definitely play in the upcoming T20 World Cup but will not pick "many wickets" in the tournament. "The mirror does not lie...he has played seven matches since the 2021 T20 World Cup, picked up just four wickets, average is above 43 and the economy is also close to 8.5," explained Aakash.

264.title: BJP to observe 'Partition Horrors Remembrance Day'
264.article_body: The BJP will organise silent marches across the country to observe the "Partition Horrors Remembrance Day" today to remind the nation of sacrifices of Indians during partition. Party national chief JP Nadda will also be taking part in the silent march in Delhi's Jantar Mantar. The leaders will also meet the relatives of those who suffered during the 1947 partition.

265.title: J&K LG Manoj Sinha leads 'Har Ghar Tiranga' rally in Srinagar
265.article_body: As part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav', the troops of BSF organised a Tiranga rally, which was led by Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha in Srinagar on Sunday. The official journey of the campaign began on March 12, 2021, which started a 75-week countdown to India's 75th anniversary of Independence. It aims to encourage people to hoist the Tricolour.

266.title: Floods triggered by seasonal rains leave 50 dead in Sudan: Official
266.article_body: Floods triggered by seasonal rainfall have left over 50 people dead and inundated over 8,170 homes in Sudan, a senior police official said on Saturday. Sudan's National Council for Civil Defense spokesperson said that about 25 people were also injured so far this year, SUNA news agency reported. About 540 feddans (acres) of agricultural land was damaged, the spokesperson added.

267.title: Rohit backed Avesh even after four failures and the pacer delivered: Parthiv
267.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel has said India captain Rohit Sharma stands out in backing players who sometimes don't perform. "Rohit is vocal about them even in public and in press conferences...as we saw with the case of Avesh Khan. Rohit backed him even after four failures [during India's tour of WI] and [Avesh] delivered with a Man-of-the-Match performance," stated Parthiv.

268.title: Ukraine targeting Russians shooting at or from nuclear plant: Zelenskyy
268.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russian soldiers who either shoot at Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant, or shoot using it as cover become a special target for Ukraine's intelligence agents. Ukraine accused Russia of hitting part of the plant which generates power for the southern Ukraine. The two sides have accused each other of carrying out shelling at the nuclear facility.

269.title: Salman Rushdie's stab wounds listed in court after attack on him in New York
269.article_body: Author Salman Rushdie suffered three stab wounds to the right side of the front of his neck, four stab wounds to his stomach, a puncture wound to his right eye and chest, and a laceration on his right thigh, according to the Chautauqua County District attorney. Rushdie was attacked in New York on Friday, after which he underwent a surgery.

270.title: Billionaire investor Jhunjhunwala began trading with ₹5,000 during his college days
270.article_body: Late veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala began trading when he was in college in 1985 with a sum of ₹5,000. While his father, who was an official in the Income Tax Department, told him not to ask him for money, Jhunjhunwala borrowed money from his brother's clients while promising them higher returns. His net worth later grew to $5 billion.

271.title: China to reopen Shanghai schools from Sept 1 with daily COVID testing
271.article_body: China's financial hub Shanghai will reopen kindergartens, nurseries, primary, middle and high schools, which had been shut since mid-March due to the spread of COVID-19, on September 1. All teachers and students in the city will have to take nucleic acid tests every day before leaving campus. Shanghai, China's most populous city, reported five new local asymptomatic cases on Saturday.

272.title: What were the top holdings of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala?
272.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away aged 62 on Sunday, held a 4% stake in Titan Company worth ₹8,728 crore, making it his top holding in terms of value. Jhunjhunwala's major holdings include Star Health & Allied Insurance, Tata Motors, Fortis Healthcare and CRISIL, Moneycontrol reported. Jhunjhunwala had a net worth of more than ₹46,000 crore, as per Forbes.

273.title: Search operation on to trace 3 missing people in UP’s Banda
273.article_body: Rescue and search operation is on for three missing people in UP’s Banda district where a boat capsized on August 11. A total of 12 bodies have been recovered so far. “NDRF, SDRF and police teams are carrying out rescue operations...The flow in the river is high which is creating problems in the operation,” Banda SP Abhinandan said.

274.title: Man fires shots at Canberra Airport in Australia, arrested
274.article_body: Australia's Canberra Airport was evacuated after a man fired shots on the premises on Sunday, the police said. The man has been taken into custody and the firearm has been recovered, the police added. "CCTV has been reviewed and at this time the person in custody is believed to be the only person responsible," the police further said.

275.title: 'Laal...' deserves to succeed, maybe bit too overstated emotionally: Hansal
275.article_body: On Twitter, filmmaker Hansal Mehta wrote that Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' deserves to succeed. "It's a very engaging film made with passion...love. Maybe a bit too overstated emotionally...a bit superficial politically for my taste but a film made with so much care, heart...honesty," he added. Hansal said he found himself moist-eyed or smiling for a major part of it.

276.title: Tata Tea Premium unveils #DeshKaGarv collection on 75th Independence Day
276.article_body: This Independence Day, Tata Tea Premium in collaboration with The Plated Project presents limited-edition #DeshKaGarv Art collection. With this, the brand aims to commemorate events from India’s past that contributed to her pride & glory globally. All proceeds from the collection purchased will be donated to sponsor meals for underprivileged children, enabling them to build a better future.

277.title: Never wanted the world to find out this way I called you Bhaiyya: Smriti on Jhunjhunwala
277.article_body: After billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's demise, Union Minister Smriti Irani wrote, "I never wanted the world to find out this way that I love you and called you Bhaiyya." "Since the day I was married, you never made me feel that I am to be treated like a daughter in law...I don't want to say goodbye," she added.

278.title: Info Edge invests ₹300 crore in its subsidiary Startup Investments
278.article_body: Noida-based IT firm Info Edge invested ₹300 crore in its fully-owned subsidiary Startup Investments (Holding) Limited (SIHL), the firm said in a regulatory filing. The capital will be used to explore other investment opportunities like contribution towards alternative investment funds (AIFs) managed by Info Edge-owned Smartweb Internet Services. Info Edge owns portals like Naukri and 99acres.

279.title: India has the 3rd largest startup ecosystem: Jitendra Singh
279.article_body: Union Minister of State Jitendra Singh said that India has the third largest startup ecosystem and the third highest number of unicorns. While delivering a keynote address, Singh mentioned that this decade is expected to bring transformational changes for Indian science, technology and innovation (STI). He also said that over 49% startups are from tier two and three cities.

280.title: 21-year-old youth booked after minor ends life in Ambala
280.article_body: Police arrested a 21-year-old college student in Ambala on charges of abetment to suicide after a 17-year-old girl died allegedly after consuming some poisonous substance. The deceased girl’s father, in his complaint, told the police that the youth and his daughter were in a relationship. He had promised to marry the girl but later backtracked, the complainant added.

281.title: Mumbai Police destroys 151 high-volume modified silencers of 2-wheelers
281.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Traffic Police crushed 151 seized modified high-volume silencers of two-wheelers with a road roller. Police said that modifying silencers with high volume is not permitted and many bikers install it for thrill. Strict action will also be taken against garage owners who install such silencers, Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic) Purushottam Karad said.

282.title: After tremendous pressure, RSS finally changes profile pics to Tiranga: Khera
282.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Khera commented on RSS changing the display pictures of its social media accounts to the Tricolour. "After tremendous pressure for a week, a sheepish RSS finally changes profile pictures to Tiranga," Khera tweeted. RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat also changed his social media profile picture to the national flag.

283.title: J'khand judge's murder shook judiciary, citizens; led to fear: Court
283.article_body: In the sentencing order regarding Judge Uttam Anand's murder in Jharkhand's Dhanbad, Additional Sessions Judge (ASJ) Rajni Kant Pathak said that the incident shook the judicial fraternity and the citizens. "After the incident, there was an atmosphere of fear among the family members of judicial officers and the people of the country," the order said.

284.title: What an absolute blast: 'Baby Driver' director on Rajamouli's 'RRR'
284.article_body: 'Baby Driver' director Edgar Wright praised SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' on Twitter. "Finally saw 'RRR' on the big screen at the BFI with a great crowd. What an absolute blast. So entertaining," he tweeted. He further wrote, "The only film I've ever seen where the intermission card itself got a round of applause." The film featured Jr NTR and Ram Charan.

285.title: Rushdie's attacker pleads not guilty, his lawyer says 'People need to keep an open mind'
285.article_body: The man accused of stabbing author Salman Rushdie has pleaded not guilty to charges of attempted murder and assault. The 24-year-old accused Hadi Matar's lawyer said, "I think the important thing to remember is people need to keep an open mind. They need to look at everything. They can't just assume something happened for why they think something happened."

286.title: Pluses & minuses aside, 'Laal Singh...' is magnificent: Hrithik Roshan
286.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Hrithik Roshan praised Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and wrote, "I felt the heart of this movie." "Just watched 'Laal Singh Chaddha'...Pluses and minuses aside, this movie is just magnificent," he further added. Calling 'Laal Singh Chaddha' a "gem", Hrithik urged people to watch the film. The film, directed by Advait Chandan, also features Kareena Kapoor.

287.title: US man drinks liquid in court during child sexual assault conviction, dies
287.article_body: A 57-year-old man died after he drank a bottle of liquid, which appeared to be cloudy, while being convicted of child abuse in court in US' Texas. The defence lawyer said that man started vomiting shortly after entering the holding cell, following which emergency services were called. The man's hand was "shaking", but he kept drinking, the defence lawyer added.

288.title: Man slits wife's throat inside family court after deciding to reunite in Karnataka
288.article_body: A man has been arrested in Karnataka's Hassan for allegedly killing his wife by slitting her throat inside a family court, where they had come for counselling after filing for divorce, police said. The accused had agreed to reunite with her during the counselling and attacked her in the court's restroom. He tried to escape but was caught by people.

289.title: My intent was not to victimise myself: CEO who posted crying selfie after firing staff
289.article_body: US-based HyperSocial’s CEO Braden Wallake, who posted a photo of himself crying on LinkedIn after firing employees, shared another post following criticism. He wrote, "I'm the crying CEO. No, my intent was not to make it about me or victimise myself. I'm sorry it came across that way. It wasn't my place to out the employees' names publicly."

290.title: Akasa Air issues statement after Jhunjhunwala's death, says 'Will honour his legacy'
290.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air on Sunday issued a statement after the death of the veteran investor. It said, "We are deeply saddened by the untimely demise of Mr Jhunjhunwala…We cannot thank [him] enough for...putting his trust...in us to build a world-class airline. [He] had an invincible spirit...Akasa Air will honour [his] legacy, values and belief in us".

291.title: Such pettiness: Congress to CM Bommai for 'Har Ghar...' ad without Nehru
291.article_body: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said that Karnataka CM BS Bommai insulted his father SR Bommai and his father's first political guru MN Roy, who were great Nehru admirers, by excluding Jawaharlal Nehru's photo from 'Har Ghar Tiranga' newspaper ad. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Nehru will survive such pettiness. CM Karnataka desperate to save his job...Pathetic this is."

292.title: It was shocking for me: Aakash on Chahal missing T20 WC last year
292.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said that he was "shocked" when Yuzvendra Chahal was not named in India's squad for the T20 World Cup last year. Aakash added that the 32-year-old is "definitely going to Australia" for the upcoming T20 World Cup. He further said, "Chahal is the number one genuine wicket-taker that [we] have."

293.title: Scindia to celebrate ‘Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav’ in Gwalior
293.article_body: As part of Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav, Union Minister of Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia will inaugurate photo exhibition and preside over various programmes at Maharani Lakshmi Bai Ki Chhatri and Central Jail in Gwalior today. He will also observe ‘Partition Horrors Remembrance Day’ to remind the nation of the sacrifices made by Indians during the partition in 1947.

294.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala died of cardiac arrest, was suffering from multiple ailments
294.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala passed away at the age of 62 after suffering a cardiac arrest, as per the death certificate issued. Notably, Jhunjhunwala had been suffering from multiple ailments, including kidney disease and ischemic heart disease and was brought dead to Breach Candy Hospital around 6.45 am on Sunday. He will be cremated today evening in Mumbai.

295.title: Ram Janmbhoomi temple hoists national flag in Ayodhya
295.article_body: As part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, the national flag was hoisted at the Ram Janmbhoomi temple complex in Ayodhya. Participating in this campaign were the officers and staff of the Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra trust, including the construction workers. The campaign aims to encourage people to hoist the flag to mark the 75th year of India’s independence.

296.title: Police taser parents trying to enter school under lockdown in US
296.article_body: The police arrested three parents and tasered two of them after they tried to enter a school in US' Arizona, which was under lockdown following reports of a male suspect carrying a handgun attempting to get on campus. The incident occurred as parents tried to forcefully enter the buildings, police said. The suspect has been taken into custody, police added.

297.title: Jhunjhunwala symbol of entrepreneurial spirit, will be remembered for Akasa Air: Scindia
297.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya M Scindia on Sunday said that billionaire investor and Akasa Air co-founder Rakesh Jhunjhunwala was a symbol of India's entrepreneurial spirit and will remain an inspiration for the youth of the country. Scindia added, "He will be remembered for giving India its new airline Akasa Air after more than a decade."

298.title: You have to give Dhawan importance: Karim on captaincy change
298.article_body: Talking about KL Rahul replacing Shikhar Dhawan as India captain for the ODI series against Zimbabwe, ex-India cricketer Saba Karim said, "You have to give Dhawan importance once you make the announcement as captain." He added, "Rahul should have played the series only as a member." Dhawan, who was initially named captain, has been named Rahul's deputy for the series.

299.title: Jhunjhunwala was my school mate, believed stock India was undervalued: Kotak
299.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak expressed his condolences after the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. Kotak said Jhunjhunwala was his school and college mate and a year junior to him. "[He] believed stock India was undervalued. He was right. Amazingly sharp in understanding financial markets," Kotak tweeted. Both Kotak and Jhunjhunwala graduated from Mumbai's Sydenham College.

300.title: Kalam's dream of India becoming superpower to be realised by 2047: Union Minister
300.article_body: Union Minister L Murugan on Saturday said that under PM Narendra Modi's governance, the country is moving towards the path of becoming a superpower in the global arena. "The dream of former President APJ Abdul Kalam [of] making India a superpower would be realised by 2047 when the country celebrates its 100th year of independence," Murugan added.

301.title: Varun Dhawan meets Indian cricket team, says 'Was like boy in candy shop'
301.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan met the Indian cricket team at the Mumbai airport. Varun took to Twitter and shared pictures with the team. Along with the pictures, he wrote, "At four in the morning, I was like a boy in a candy shop. Got very excited to meet and chat with our men in blue about their upcoming tour," Varun tweeted.

302.title: Rajasthan CM assures speedy probe after Dalit boy's death, announces ₹5 lakh for family
302.article_body: After a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten to death by his teacher for drinking water from his pot in Rajasthan's Jalore, state Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said that justice will be ensured to the family of the victim at the earliest. The Chief Minister added that an assistance amount of ₹5 lakh will be given to the family of deceased.

303.title: IAS officer shares pic of Tricolour face masks, says 'please don't buy such masks'
303.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, IAS officer Awanish Sharan shared a picture of face masks made out of the Tricolour. "Please do not make, buy or use such masks," he wrote. Several Twitter users criticised such masks, with one saying, "It's better to find out makers of this mask & launch FIR for disrespect of our flag."

304.title: Want to do roles that aren't me like Rani Bharti of 'Maharani': Huma
304.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, speaking about the current phase of her acting career after featuring in the 'Maharani' series, said she's having fun. "Being a hardcore Delhi girl, I have certain life...experiences but I want to do roles that aren't me such as Rani Bharti of 'Maharani'," she added. She stated she is "nowhere" close to Rani Bharti in real life.

305.title: He was an institution by himself: K'taka CM pays tribute to Jhunjhunwala
305.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai took to social media to condole the death of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. "Shocked and saddened by the untimely demise of ace stock trader and investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala this morning. A role model for many young investors, he was an institution by himself. May his soul rest in peace," he tweeted.

306.title: Breaks my heart to know my friend is no more: Vedanta chief on Jhunjhunwala's death
306.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal on Sunday tweeted a photo of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala while condoling his death. Agarwal wrote, "Breaks my heart to know that a friend of mine, and more widely known as the big bull of our stock market, is no more…Rakesh Jhunjhunwala will forever be known as the man who popularised public understanding of stock markets."

307.title: Let's see film on Poo someday, she's relevant with this generation: Kareena
307.article_body: Kareena Kapoor has said her 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' character Poo is relevant to the current generation. "The way she is, the way she talks, the kind of millennial Gen-Z kind of words that she uses connect somehow...Let's see a film someday, who knows," she added. 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' was directed by Karan Johar and featured Shah Rukh Khan.

308.title: SP's Maurya sends ₹11.50 cr defamation notice to Noida Police chief
308.article_body: SP leader Swami Prasad Maurya claimed to have sent a defamation notice to GB Nagar Police Commissioner for linking him to politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested for assaulting and abusing a woman in Noida. Maurya has sought ₹11.50 crore as general and special compensation for loss of reputation and family honour, mental torture and physical agony.

309.title: Kamath posts pic with Jhunjhunwala, says 'There'll never be someone like you'
309.article_body: Stockbroking platform Zerodha's Co-founder Nikhil Kamath condoled the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away aged 62. Sharing a picture with him on Twitter, Kamath wrote, "There will never again be someone like you, RIP." Jhunjhunwala, who was reportedly suffering from diabetes and a kidney ailment, was brought dead to Mumbai's Breach Candy Hospital on Sunday morning.

310.title: 9-yr-old Dalit boy beaten to death by teacher for drinking water from his pot in Raj
310.article_body: A nine-year-old Dalit boy in Rajasthan's Jalore district died on Saturday after he was allegedly beaten by his school teacher for drinking water from his pot. "My son didn't know that the pot was meant for [teacher Chail] Singh, who belongs to an upper caste," the boy's father said. A case has been registered under SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

311.title: Investor, risk taker & a leader in his own right: Sitharaman on Jhunjhunwala's death
311.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman took to Twitter to condole the death of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. She tweeted, "Shri Rakesh Jhunjhunwala is no more. Investor, bold risk taker, masterly understanding of the stock market, clear in communication- a leader in his own right. Fondly remember several conversations we had. Had strong belief in India's strength and capabilities."

312.title: Jhunjhunwala inspired investors, he will be remembered for his bullish outlook: Shah
312.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday tweeted, "Anguished to learn about the passing away of Rakesh Jhunjhunwala Ji. His vast experience and understanding of the stock market have inspired countless investors." The minister added, "He will always be remembered for his bullish outlook. My deepest condolences to his family. Om Shanti Shanti."

313.title: Security in place for flag hoisting at Idgah Maidan: Bengaluru Police
313.article_body: After Karnataka government asked police to hoist national flag at Idgah Maidan, the Bengaluru Police Commissioner said that all security arrangements have been made for Independence Day celebration and if situation demands, additional forces will be deployed. "We have deployed a KSRP battalion, a police inspector and 10 police constables," Additional Commissioner of Police Sandeep Patil said.

314.title: Adani condoles Jhunjhunwala's death, calls him India's 'most legendary investor'
314.article_body: Asia's richest man and Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani condoled the demise of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. Adani tweeted, "Extremely saddened by the untimely passing away of the most legendary investor that India has had. Shri Jhunjhunwala inspired an entire generation to believe in our equity markets with his brilliant views." Jhunjhunwala passed away aged 62 on Sunday.

315.title: 15 people injured after car crashes into a pub in US' Virginia
315.article_body: Nine people were taken to hospitals and six others were treated on the scene after a car crashed into a pub in Arlington in US' Virginia, according to authorities. The crash also caused a fire to break out, which was quickly extinguished by the fire department, police said. Two of the injured people are in critical condition, the police added.

316.title: People live on roadside in Delhi as Yamuna water enters low-lying areas
316.article_body: Several people resorted to living on the roadside in Delhi after overflowing water from the Yamuna river inundated low-lying areas, news agency ANI reported. Reports said that low-lying areas near Mayur Vihar Phase I and Akshardham Temple were flooded due to the overflowing Yamuna river. "The water came gushing in...I immediately rushed to evacuate my family members," a woman said.

317.title: End of an era as the 'Big Bull of the Dalal Street' passes away: Virender Sehwag
317.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to condole the demise of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. He tweeted, "End of an era as the Big Bull of the Dalal Street passes away. Condolences to his family and loved ones. Om Shanti." Jhunjhunwala, who was suffering from diabetes and a kidney ailment, passed away aged 62 on Sunday.

318.title: Nitish's growing national ambition reason why he broke ties with BJP: Sushil Modi
318.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi commented on JD(U) breaking its alliance with BJP in Bihar, saying that the real reason behind this was Bihar CM Nitish Kumar’s "failing popularity, growing national ambition and a desire to gain political strength". Sushil Modi told The Print, "Nitish calculated...allying with RJD would give him more seats in LS and Assembly elections...thus protect his turf."

319.title: Those who made threat calls to MLAs were in touch with Pak handlers: Haryana Police
319.article_body: Haryana Police have said that accused who made death threat calls to some of the MLAs were in touch with their handlers in Pakistan. The investigators have also found that the accused had allegedly transacted ₹2.7 crore through 727 bank accounts in last eight months. Police have found 18 virtual numbers operating from abroad in phones of six arrested men.

320.title: 8 Israelis injured in shooting near Jerusalem's Old City
320.article_body: A gunman opened fire at a bus parked near the Western Wall near Jerusalem's Old City. The suspected Palestinian attack left eight Israelis injured including two who are critical. Israeli police searched for the attacker in the nearby Palestinian neighbourhood of Silwan. The attack comes after a week of clashes between Israelis and Palestinians in Gaza and West Bank.

321.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala was brought dead to the hospital: Breach Candy CEO
321.article_body: Veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away at the age of 62 on Sunday morning, was brought dead to the Mumbai hospital, Breach Candy Hospital CEO N Santhanam told The Indian Express. Jhunjhunwala was suffering from diabetes and a kidney ailment, a doctor said. As per reports, he was admitted to the hospital a few days ago and later discharged.

322.title: Will not let honour of India get sacrificed: Rajnath Singh
322.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh criticised the Opposition for politicising border security with China. “Those who raise questions against the national security, I as the Defence Minister, want to assure them that no matter how hard it gets I will not let the honour of India get sacrificed. Due to PM Modi, India’s security...has become stronger than ever,” said Singh.

323.title: Markets will grow at a slower pace: Jhunjhunwala in last interview before his death
323.article_body: In his last interview before his death, billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala remarked that the Indian "markets will grow at a slower pace regardless of global developments". In a video of his remarks, he added, "I think Indian markets will gain but they will gain at a slower pace." Jhunjhunwala passed away at the age of 62 on Sunday in Mumbai.

324.title: Congress leader Deepender Hooda tests COVID positive
324.article_body: Congress leader Deepender Singh Hooda has tested COVID-19 positive for the second time in a year. “After experiencing symptoms, I got myself tested and my COVID report is positive. With the advice of doctors, I am isolating myself and starting the related treatment. Because of this, I have to stay away from next few programs,” said Hooda.

325.title: N Korea criticises UN chief for supporting its denuclearisation
325.article_body: North Korea criticised UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres for supporting full denuclearisation of North Korea, saying remarks lack impartiality and fairness. "Complete, verifiable and irreversible denuclearisation was an infringement upon sovereignty of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea," North Korea added. Seoul and Washington suspect North Korea is preparing to test a nuclear weapon.

326.title: India reports 14,092 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate stands at 3.69%
326.article_body: India has reported 14,092 new COVID-19 cases and 41 deaths in the last 24 hours, including 12 reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,16,861, while the daily positivity rate stood at 3.69%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,27,037.

327.title: When the PM speaks with us, it feels like the country is supporting: Harmanpreet
327.article_body: India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur, who met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday, has said it's important to receive motivation from the country's PM. She added, "When PM Modi speaks with us, it feels like the entire country is supporting us and that everybody is appreciating our hard work." PM Modi met with athletes who participated in the 2022 CWG.

328.title: 13 Chinese planes crossed Taiwan Strait's median line: Taiwan
328.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry has said that 13 Chinese air force planes had crossed Taiwan Strait's median line on Saturday. This comes as the country's Foreign Ministry thanked the US for taking "concrete actions" to maintain security and peace in the region the same day. China had launched military drills around Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit.

329.title: PM Modi condoles Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's demise, says 'he was full of life, witty'
329.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled the demise of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala and wrote, "Rakesh Jhunjhunwala was indomitable. Full of life, witty and insightful, he leaves behind an indelible contribution to the financial world." "He was also very passionate about India's progress. His passing away is saddening," he added. Widely known as the 'Big Bull', Jhunjhunwala passed away aged 62.

330.title: Big B used to meet me after shoot, call me for his Diwali parties: Pavail
330.article_body: Actor Pavail Gulati said that actor Amitabh Bachchan is "a very special person". "He was very kind to me while we were shooting 'Yudh'. Even after shoot, he used to meet me and call me for his Diwali parties. He is an extremely genuine host," Pavail said, adding that it is fun being around him and his energy is infectious.

331.title: BJP rattled by developments in Bihar, state taught them lesson: Akhilesh
331.article_body: Following the recent political change in Bihar, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said BJP is "rattled" by the developments there. "Bihar has taught them a lesson," Yadav added. The Hindustan Times reported that on being asked, "How will Bihar impact the Opposition politics?" Yadav said, "Bihar has also sent a message to the Opposition, the message of alliance and cohesiveness."

332.title: Extremely heavy to very heavy rainfall warning in several states; list released
332.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted extremely heavy rainfall in Odisha, east Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh on August 14 and in central Maharashtra and west Madhya Pradesh on August 15. Meanwhile, isolated very heavy rainfall is likely over Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Goa and Gujarat between August 14 and 16.

333.title: Sara Ali Khan will do 2 films with me, we're excited: Karan Johar
333.article_body: Filmmaker-producer Karan Johar has said that actress Sara Ali Khan will be doing two films that will be produced by Karan's Dharma Productions. "Sara is going to do an amazing film with me, which I'm producing...we are very excited. And there's one more film that she will do for us, for which I'm also very excited," he stated.

334.title: Over 15,000 potholes repaired in past 30 days in Mumbai: BMC
334.article_body: More than 15,000 potholes have been patched and 22,988 road craters have been filled in Mumbai in the last 30 days, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. Andheri West area remains the most-affected from potholes as 1,667 of them alone were found in western suburbs. Recently, BMC invited tenders worth ₹7 crore to repair cratered roads with better techniques.

335.title: Shiv Sangram chief Vinayak Mete dies in car crash on Mumbai-Pune Expressway
335.article_body: Shiv Sangram chief Vinayak Mete was killed after his car met with an accident on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway near Khopoli on Sunday, Raigad district collector Mahendra Kalyankar said. Reports said that Mete was admitted to MGM Hospital in Kamothe. Police said that Mete's driver was trying to overtake a truck when the accident took place.

336.title: Wanted to substitute entire team: Ten Hag on Man Utd's 4-0 loss vs Brentford
336.article_body: After Manchester United's second straight defeat in the Premier League season, manager Erik ten Hag said he wanted to substitute his entire team at half-time against Brentford. Manchester United conceded four goals in the first 35 minutes to suffer a 4-0 defeat in the game. "I think we all have seen the game...Brentford was more hungry," added Ten Hag.

337.title: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala passes away aged 62
337.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who was widely known as 'India's Warren Buffett' and the 'Big Bull', has passed away at the age of 62. Jhunjhunwala had recently attended the launch of commercial operations of Akasa Air on August 7, an airline co-founded by him and former Jet Airways CEO Vinay Dube.

338.title: 1st batch of explosives reach site ahead of Noida's twin towers' demolition
338.article_body: Ahead of the demolition of twin towers in Noida, the first batch of explosives have reached the site. Reports said that more than 3,500 kg of explosives will be filled in around 9,400 holes drilled in columns and shears of the skeletal structures of the twin towers for the demolition. Officials said the charging process will take around 15 days.

339.title: We are in a good space now: Raqesh Bapat on his break-up with Shamita
339.article_body: Actor Raqesh Bapat, speaking about his music video with his ex-girlfriend Shamita Shetty, has said, "I think it is mutual respect. We are in a good space now." He added it's important for them to concentrate on their respective careers. "We...are in a space where we're fortunate to have gone through...many experiences and...we have dealt with it," he added.

340.title: Traffic diversions issued in Hyderabad for Independence Day celebration
340.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police issued an advisory for 75th Independence Day celebration at Rani Mahal lawns in Golconda on Monday. As per the advisory, the route from Ramdev Guda to Golconda Fort will be blocked for all ordinary vehicular traffic as part of the detours and the traffic restrictions will be enforced between 7 am and 12 noon.

341.title: Some people think Shiv Sena is object lying in open: Uddhav Thackeray
341.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said some people think Shiv Sena is an object lying in the open which they can pick it up and take it away. Shiv Sena's foundations are "deep-rooted and strong" and no one can stake claim over the party, he added. Thackeray was addressing the 62nd foundation day of Shiv Sena's weekly 'Marmik'.

342.title: Understand fiscal strength of your state before promising something for free: Sitharaman
342.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has asked the states giving 'freebies' to check the fiscal strength of the state government and make budgetary provision accordingly. She said, "Do it but make sure you understand the financial level of your state, the fiscal strength of your state...making sure that your budget will have a provision for it," she said.

343.title: Coaching teacher kidnaps Maha girl, police rescues her within 12 hrs
343.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was rescued by the police from a remote farmhouse in Maharashtra's Palghar within 12 hours of her being missing. Reports said that the girl was allegedly kidnapped by a coaching class teacher who was reportedly upset about withdrawal of girl's enrolment from his class. The teacher kidnapped the girl when she was returning from school.

344.title: There will be blood on the streets: Google executives reportedly warn staff about layoffs
344.article_body: Google executives reportedly warned staff about layoffs in case of poor results. Employees at the Google Cloud sales department said the senior leadership told them that there will be an "overall examination of sales productivity and productivity in general." If third-quarter results "don’t look up, [then] there will be blood on the streets," according to a message conveyed to them.

345.title: Joe Biden issues statement on attack on Salman Rushdie, says 'Shocked and saddened'
345.article_body: US President Joe Biden has issued a statement on the attack on author Salman Rushdie. "Jill and I were shocked and saddened to learn of the vicious attack on Salman Rushdie," he wrote. "Salman Rushdie—with his insight into humanity, with his unmatched sense for story, with his refusal to be intimidated or silenced—stands for essential, universal ideals," he added.

346.title: 700-year-old handmade paper made in 1320 restored by Pune institute
346.article_body: Pune's Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute has restored a 700-year-old paper made in 1320. Officials said that this is the oldest paper in Maharashtra. "This is a handmade paper made up of a bulk of tress. It has withstood any corrupt microbiological elements and we intend to keep it that way by preserving it," the chairman of the institute said.
