347.title: Bradman averaged 101.39 before last Test, ended with 99.94 after getting out on a duck
347.article_body: Legendary Australian batter Donald Bradman had scored 6,996 Test runs at an average of 101.39 as he came out to bat for the last time on August 14, 1948. Bradman was bowled for a duck by a googly from England's Eric Hollies in his last innings and finished four short of 7,000 runs, and with a record average of 99.94.

348.title: I see a lot of hate, don't know why people get annoyed: Karan on love for Alia
348.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said that he sees a lot of hate for the relationship that he shares with actress Alia Bhatt. "I don't know why people get so annoyed. I'm allowed to love somebody from my heart," Karan said, adding, "She's the first person I felt like I had a parental instinct for."

349.title: Kiara says she met Sidharth 5 years ago, heard about Shershaah at a party
349.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani said that she met actor Sidharth Malhotra at a party five years ago. She also said that she heard about the movie 'Shershaah' at the party and was cast for the role of 'Dimple' opposite Sidharth years later. As 'Shershaah' completed one year, they also recalled how Sidharth forced Kiara to cheat on her diet during shoot.

350.title: You can't ignore this: Aanand on 'Raksha...' being called regressive
350.article_body: Reacting to his film 'Raksha Bandhan' being called regressive, director Aanand L Rai said, "You can't ignore this...there are many things that need to be taken care of...you can't shut your eyes off." He added if the audience finds that there is something regressive about the Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Raksha Bandhan', that means there is time to correct the society.

351.title: Author Salman Rushdie taken off ventilator, able to talk: Agent
351.article_body: Salman Rushdie was taken off ventilator and able to talk on Saturday, his agent confirmed after the author was stabbed on stage in New York. Fellow author Aatish Taseer had earlier tweeted that Rushdie was "off the ventilator and talking (and joking)". His attacker has been identified as Hadi Matar.

352.title: B'luru tutor beats 15-yr-old boy with iron pipe, injures his head; held
352.article_body: A tutor recently injured a Class 10 student's head after beating him with an iron pipe at a coaching centre near Bengaluru's Yelahanka. The tutor, Vijay Kumar, was arrested following a complaint by the 15-year-old boy's parents. Kumar said he wanted to threaten some boys over their "arrogant" reply by swaying an iron rod and never intended to beat them.

353.title: Sachin Tendulkar scored 1st of his 100 international hundreds as a 17-year-old
353.article_body: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar scored his maiden international hundred at the age of 17 years and 112 days on August 14, 1990, in a Test against England at Old Trafford. Playing in his ninth Test, Sachin scored 119*(189) in the second innings to help India draw the match. Sachin is the third youngest player to score a Test ton.

354.title: PSG set to offer Man Utd's Marcus Rashford long-term contract: Reports
354.article_body: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford is set to be offered a long-term contract by Paris Saint-Germain, reports said. PSG manager Christopher Galtier is looking to pair Rashford with Kylian Mbappe in a two-man attack, reports added. Reports had earlier claimed there were "positive discussions" between the player and the Parisian football club regarding a transfer.

355.title: Tropical Storm Meari brings heavy rains in Japan
355.article_body: Tropical Storm Meari, with wind speeds of 72 km/h, brought heavy rains to Japan's Honshu island on Saturday as it moved northward towards the capital Tokyo. Over 72,000 people in the island's main city were asked to evacuate due to possible landslides. The storm is expected to move northward and then eastward into the Pacific Ocean by early Sunday.

356.title: Violence not a response to words: UN chief on Rushdie stabbing
356.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was "appalled" to learn about the attack on author Salman Rushdie, saying 'violence cannot be a response to words'. Rushdie was stabbed by a 24-year-old man in New York on Friday. "In no case is violence a response to words...written by others in their exercise of the freedoms of opinion and expression," Guterres said.

357.title: Himachal Pradesh records 423 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
357.article_body: Himachal Pradesh on Saturday reported 423 fresh cases of COVID-19, officials said, taking the state's active case count to 3,024. One death due to the infection was recorded in Sirmaur district. The state's death toll due to COVID-19 reached 4,163. On Friday, Himachal Pradesh had logged 443 cases of the infection and one fatality.

358.title: Army, NDRF teams reach MP's Dhar district after dam breached
358.article_body: The Army and National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel reached Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district on Saturday after an under-construction dam on the Karam river was breached. The government said water from the reservoir was being safely drained out to reduce pressure on its wall. People from 18 downstream villages have been preemptively shifted to safer areas.

359.title: Doctors conduct health check-up of jailed former WB minister
359.article_body: A team of eight doctors from state-run SSKM Hospital conducted a health check-up of jailed former West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee at the Presidency Correctional Home in Kolkata on Saturday, an official said. The suspended Trinamool Congress leader had complained of back and leg pain. Chatterjee was prescribed exercises and a specific diet to control blood sugar, the official said.

360.title: Delhi reports 2,031 fresh COVID-19 cases, 9 deaths
360.article_body: Delhi logged 2,031 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday with a positivity rate of 12.34%, as per data shared by the health department. The city's single-day caseload remained above 2,000 for the 11th consecutive day. The national capital also recorded nine fatalities due to the infection. On Friday, Delhi had reported 10 deaths due to COVID-19, the highest in six months.

361.title: Number of Congress ministerial berth in Bihar finalised: AICC
361.article_body: Bihar in-charge of All India Congress Committee (AICC) Bhakta Charan Das on Saturday said that the number of ministerial berths Congress would get in Bihar's Mahagathbandhan government has been finalised. "The number would be [respectable and] as per our strength in the House. We've not yet finalised the names," he added. He said oath-taking is likely to happen on Tuesday.

362.title: UK minister switches sides to back Liz Truss in race for new PM
362.article_body: UK Cabinet Minister Robert Buckland who backed Rishi Sunak in the race to become Britain's next Prime Minister until recently, on Saturday switched sides to rival candidate Liz Truss' camp. Buckland said now he believes Truss is the "right person to take the country forward". He said Truss' plans are more suited to help the UK attain a "high-productivity economy".

363.title: Police arrest main accused behind dumping of meat at temple in UP
363.article_body: The main accused in the last month's meat dumping incident at a temple in Kannauj's Talgram town in Uttar Pradesh has been arrested, police said. The accused, Mansoor, is a butcher and was hired by a local, Chanchal Tripathi, to throw the meat as the latter aimed at getting the local SHO transferred. So far, 17 people have been arrested.

364.title: Video shows T'gana minister opening fire at Tiranga rally, says 'fired rubber bullet'
364.article_body: A video showing Telangana Prohibition and Excise Minister Srinivas Goud opening fire into the air from a gun at a Tiranga rally on Saturday has gone viral. The Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leader allegedly opened fire from a loaded police gun, ANI reported. Dismissing the allegation, Goud said he had fired a rubber bullet. The incident reportedly happened in Mahabubnagar.

365.title: CCI approves merger of HDFC Bank and HDFC
365.article_body: The CCI has approved the proposal of merger of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) and HDFC Bank. The board of HDFC had approved the merger of the firm with HDFC Bank in April this year. Following the merger, HDFC Bank will be 100% owned by public shareholders and existing shareholders of HDFC Limited will own 41% of HDFC Bank.

366.title: The worst Olympic federation is better than AIFF: Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal
366.article_body: Talking about the current state of All India Football Federation (AIFF), which doesn't have an elected body and is run by an SC-appointed CoA, Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal said, "What's happening on the AIFF side is extremely tragic." "I can tell you for a fact that the worst Olympic federation is better than the AIFF," he added.

367.title: Acting is a tiring job, takes an emotional toll on you: Manoj Bajpayee
367.article_body: National Award-winning actor Manoj Bajpayee in an interview called acting a "tiring job". The actor, who has been shooting continuously for various projects in the past few months, added, "You've to play various characters who've their own emotions and I've always believed in giving my best, so it takes an emotional toll which takes...long time to come out of it."

368.title: What is true is true: Johar on revealing Sara and Kartik's relationship
368.article_body: Karan Johar has responded after being accused of sharing personal details about celebrities' relationships on his talk show 'Koffee with Karan'. Johar, who confirmed Sara Ali Khan and Kartik Aaryan's relationship in one of the episodes, said, "Everyone knows about these relationships. I'm not making anything up." "What's true is true and I suppose everyone's okay with it," he added.

369.title: Germany urges businesses to curb heating to reduce gas consumption
369.article_body: Germany's Economy Minister on Saturday said that German businesses and public institutions should heat their offices no higher than 19 degrees Celsius this winter to help reduce consumption of natural gas. Germany aims to reduce its dependence on gas from Russia in response to the invasion of Ukraine. Notably, Germany has also imposed sanctions on Russia due to the invasion.

370.title: 24-hour rail strike to hit holidayers and football fans in UK
370.article_body: Thousands of UK train drivers went on a 24-hour strike on Saturday, protesting against proposed job cuts and demanding better pay and working conditions. Many British rail companies are considering employment cuts as the country experienced a 40-year-high rate of inflation this year. The strike is set to disturb the plans of holidayers and football fans going to stadiums.

371.title: VLC Media Player website & download link blocked in India
371.article_body: The website of VLC Media Player, one of the most popular media players across multiple platforms, has been blocked by the government in India. Users are unable to download the program's exe file for installation from the website videolan.org. However, the media player's Android app is still available on Google Play Store and already-installed players are also working, reports said.

372.title: India didn't let China intrude into its territory: Rajnath Singh
372.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday said that India did not let Chinese forces trespass on its territory. "Many incidents happened in this matter, which only we two-three people know," Rajnath stated. "I cannot divulge those details," he added. The Defence Minister further urged political parties not to politicise issues related to national security.

373.title: Saumya Tandon urges fans to donate for Deepesh Bhan's family to repay ₹50 lakh home loan
373.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actress Saumya Tandon launched an initiative to help late actor Deepesh Bhan's family. She requested people to donate and help Deepesh's family repay a home loan worth ₹50 lakh. "He...often used to talk about his home...Now, we can repay him by giving back his house to his son," said Saumya.

374.title: When I was low, I met PM Modi and he gave me motivation: CWG 2022 gold medallist Vinesh
374.article_body: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat, who bagged gold at CWG 2022, said that she almost gave up wrestling as she couldn't win a medal in two successive Olympics. "When I was low, I met Modi ji (PM Narendra Modi) and he gave me motivation. He said 'We trust you and you can do it'. That reignited the spark in me," she stated.

375.title: Ex-Chelsea footballer Willian leaves Corinthians after death threats
375.article_body: Former Arsenal and Chelsea player Willian said he has terminated his contract and left Sao Paulo-based club Corinthians after receiving death threats. "I did not come to Brazil to get threatened...If sometimes I was not doing well...my family received threats and curses," said the Brazilian. On Friday, Willian expressed his wish to return to Europe again.

376.title: Afraid of losing social prestige during ED investigation: Kolkata Mayor
376.article_body: Kolkata Municipal Corporation (KMC) Mayor Firhad Hakim on Saturday said he's not afraid of going to jail, but afraid of losing social prestige during the investigation process of Enforcement Directorate (ED). "Several saints of Bengal have been to jail. But, everyone is scared of loss of...social prestige and while ED starts their investigation, media starts their own trial," Hakim said.

377.title: Firefighters halt spread of "monster" wildfire in France's Gironde
377.article_body: Firefighters have managed to halt the spread of a "monster" blaze that has ravaged forests in France's Gironde region since Tuesday, according to French authorities. Notably, storms are expected to sweep through France on Saturday night, bringing down temperatures and prompting severe weather warnings. Successive heatwaves have sparked wildfires across Europe this summer.

378.title: Carlo Ancelotti to retire after current Real Madrid stint
378.article_body: Record four-time UEFA Champions League-winning head coach Carlo Ancelotti has said that he will retire after his current stint with Real Madrid. "Real Madrid means top level, so it makes sense to consider this club as the end of my career," said the 63-year-old. Ancelotti's current contract with the club runs until June 2024.

379.title: Will hold classes for those doubting RSS' contribution in independence: Surya
379.article_body: BJYM President Tejasvi Surya said that the BJP's youth wing will hold history classes for those who are questioning RSS' contribution to India's freedom struggle. "It is unfortunate that...a typical history was taught which is only about appreciating a single-family. Whereas the contribution of freedom fighters including...Veer Savarkar...and others is purposely neglected," Surya said.

380.title: Pakistan set to attend counter-terror exercises in India: Report
380.article_body: Pakistan will attend counter-terrorism drills which will be hosted by India in October this year, Press Trust of India reported on Saturday quoting Pakistani media. The drills will be held under the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation. The exercise will see participation from China, Russia, Iran, Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan besides India.

381.title: 'Wedding kits' with condoms, contraceptive pills to be given to newly married couples in Odisha
381.article_body: Odisha government has decided to provide 'wedding kits' to newly married couples from September to raise awareness about family planning. The kits will contain contraceptive pills, condoms and a booklet on methods and benefits of family planning among other items. "This is...part of the National Health Mission's 'Nai Pahal Scheme'," Director of Family Planning Bijay Panigrahy said.

382.title: A lot of older players will get offers from various T20 leagues: Chappell
382.article_body: Former cricketer Ian Chappell said that many "older players will get offers" from various T20 leagues and it will pose a challenge to several cricket boards. "If you've got a decent IPL contract and the choice is between Australia and your IPL franchise's UAE team, well are you going to put your IPL contract at risk?" Chappell asked.

383.title: WHO gives new names to monkeypox variants 'to avoid causing offence'
383.article_body: WHO has announced new names for variants of the monkeypox virus, in order to "avoid causing offence to any cultural, social, national, regional, professional or ethnic groups". The former Congo Basin (Central African) clade has been renamed Clade one (I). The former West African clade will be Clade two (II) and its subclades will be Clade IIa and Clade IIb.

384.title: JK Rowling receives death threat after tweet on Salman Rushdie, shares screenshot
384.article_body: Author JK Rowling received a potential death threat following her reaction tweet to attack on Salman Rushdie in New York. "Feeling very sick right now...Let him be ok," Rowling had written after attack on Rushdie. She shared a screenshot of a user saying, "Don't worry you're next," in response to her tweet. She also shared a picture of the user.

385.title: Test cricket won't die in my lifetime but who'll be playing it: Ian Chappell
385.article_body: Former Australian skipper Ian Chappell has commented on the future of five-day cricket. "Test cricket won't die in my lifetime. But who'll be playing it?" Chappell asked. The 78-year-old added, "If you haven't got your best players, is Test cricket worth watching? The answer is probably no. Test cricket is a good game, but it's got to be well played."

386.title: High salinity found in German-Polish river after mass fish die-off
386.article_body: High levels of salinity were detected in Oder River, which runs through Germany and Poland, after a mass dying off of fish, Poland's Environment Minister Anna Moskwa said on Saturday.  Comprehensive toxicology studies are still underway in Poland, she added. Earlier, Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki said that huge amounts of chemical waste were probably dumped in the river.

387.title: 5 BJP workers arrested for throwing slippers at TN Minister's car
387.article_body: Five BJP workers have been arrested for allegedly throwing slippers at Tamil Nadu Finance Minister Palanivel Thiaga Rajan's car when he was returning from Madurai Airport. The accused have been arrested under Sections 506, 341 and 34 of the IPC. The minister was returning after paying his respects to one of the soldiers killed in the J&K Rajouri district attack.

388.title: I was once dragged into a jungle by a man in Delhi: Ratan Raajputh
388.article_body: TV actress Ratan Raajputh recalled an incident from her early days in Delhi and revealed that her phone was snatched while she was returning home from Mandi House. She added she chased the person and he brought her far away into a dense forest. "Suddenly a boy appeared...[and] he...dragged me into...forest," Ratan said, adding she got help from a student.

389.title: 4 minors accused of raping married woman in Assam's Morigaon, 1 held
389.article_body: Police on Saturday said that a 16-year-old boy was arrested in Assam's Morigaon district for allegedly raping a married woman. Three other minor boys were also allegedly involved in the crime and are currently absconding, a police official said. The victim approached the police and filed a complaint when her husband refused to "accept her", the official added.

390.title: 4 dead, 9 injured in flash flood in southwest China
390.article_body: A flash flood in southwest China left four people dead and nine others injured on Saturday, local authorities informed. In a video published by Chinese media, tourists playing in a river could be seen running for safety following a rapid rise in the river's water level. The video also showed a woman being swept away by the current.

391.title: Ayodhya Ram Temple construction to be over by December 2023: Trust
391.article_body: The Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra has said the construction of the Ayodhya Ram Temple would be completed by December 2023. "The temple will be ready for 'darshan' by devotees in December 2023," said the Trust's General Secretary Champat Rai. He also claimed that iron was not being used in the construction and the design would amaze people.

392.title: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari rewards CWG medallist Divya Kakran with ₹5 lakh
392.article_body: Northeast Delhi BJP MP Manoj Tiwari on Friday rewarded CWG 2022 medallist wrestler Divya Kakran with ₹5 lakh. This comes after Divya claimed she had not received help from the Delhi government despite living in the city for 20 years. Divya had requested the AAP government to honour her the way they honour players from Delhi who represent other states.

393.title: Shakib Al Hasan named Bangladesh captain for Asia Cup, T20 World Cup
393.article_body: The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has appointed Shakib Al Hasan as the captain for the upcoming Asia Cup and T20 World Cup. Before being named captain, Shakib was reportedly told by the cricket board to choose between playing for Bangladesh or keep endorsing "betting company" Betwinner News. The Bangladesh Test captain then ended his contract with the company.

394.title: Gippy praises Aamir's 'Laal...' look, says 'Punjabis don't like fake beards'
394.article_body: Actor-singer Gippy Grewal in an interview praised Aamir Khan's look in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', saying that the actor looks "totally like a Sardaar" in the film. Aamir grew a beard and gained weight for his role in the Advait Chandan directorial. Gippy further said, "As a Punjabi, when we see a 'Punjabi' person with fake beard, we don't like it."

395.title: Used inverted commas: Kerala MLA Jaleel on ‘Azad Kashmir’ remark
395.article_body: CPI(M)-backed Kerala MLA KT Jaleel said he only had "sympathy" for those who didn't understand his use of the double inverted commas in calling Pakistan-occupied Kashmir 'Azad Kashmir'. In his response, however, the legislator did not talk about his use of the words "India-Occupied Jammu and Kashmir". The BJP had called for the MLA to be booked for sedition.

396.title: Woman saves son from cobra in K'taka seconds before it was about to bite him, video viral
396.article_body: A video of a Karnataka woman rescuing her child from a cobra seconds before it was about to bite him has gone viral. The video is from Mandya district, and shows the child unknowingly stepping very close to the cobra. The mother acts immediately, grabs the child, holds him up on her shoulder and runs to safety.

397.title: Why is NASA preparing to crash a spacecraft into an asteroid next month?
397.article_body: NASA has said that it will intentionally crash its Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) spacecraft into an asteroid on September 26, 2022. This will be done to "demonstrate and test" DART's capability to deflect asteroids, NASA said. It could be used if, in the future, a hazardous asteroid on a collision course with Earth was ever found, it added.

398.title: PM's mother distributes national flags to kids in Guj ahead of I-Day
398.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother Heeraben Modi distributed national flags to children in Gujarat as the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign began on Saturday. A video showed the PM's mother and some children waving the Tricolour at a residence. Heeraben Modi, aged 100, also hoisted the Tricolour ahead of Independence Day. India will celebrate 75 years of independence on August 15.

399.title: Over 2,100 cattle die in Punjab due to lumpy skin disease
399.article_body: The Punjab Animal Husbandry Department has said that more than 2,100 cattle have died while over 60,000 were affected by lumpy skin disease in the state. The disease infects cows and buffaloes leading to the formation of lumps on the animal's skin. Other than Punjab, Rajasthan, Uttarakhand, Gujarat and Andaman and Nicobar Islands have been affected by the disease.

400.title: Patiala Central Jail inmate escapes after finding security lapse
400.article_body: A Patiala Central Jail inmate escaped from the prison by scaling a wall after finding no security there at 7:15 am. The costly live electricity wire fencing the jail had installed was not working at the time. Officials came to know of the escape five hours later when they tried to locate him for his court appearance.

401.title: 15 migrants found dead in desert on border with Sudan: Libya
401.article_body: At least 15 migrants were found dead in the desert on the borders with Sudan, Libyan authorities said on Saturday. The migrants were on their way from Sudan to Libya when their vehicle broke down due to lack of fuel, they added. The migrants likely attempted to reach Libya in an effort to board trafficking boats to Europe.

402.title: The Academy calls 'Laal Singh Chaddha' a 'faithful Indian adaptation'
402.article_body: The Academy on Saturday called Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' a 'faithful' adaptation of Tom Hanks' 'Forrest Gump'. "Robert Zemeckis and Eric Roth's sweeping story of a man who changes the world with kindness receives a faithful Indian adaptation," read The Academy's tweet. It further added that 'Forrest Gump' was nominated for 13 Oscars including six wins.

403.title: Time to strike last nail in terrorism's coffin has come: J&K LG
403.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha said that "the right time" to "strike the last nail in the coffin of terrorism" in the Union Territory has come. He also said some people were trying to create disturbances at the "behest of the neighbouring country". Sinha added that the younger generations should not face the same hardships as their forefathers.
